amendment.description: Amendment prohibits any post-secondary school from receiving Pell Grant funds if that school is already ineligible to participate in the Federally guaranteed student loan program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 11 in the Congressional Record of July 28, 1995, to prohibit any post-secondary school from receiving Pell Grant funds if that school has a greater than 25% default rate on student loans under the Guaranteed Student Loan Program.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Gordon amendment (A022) Agreed to by voice vote.
